question: f(x) \ = \ 5x \ - \ 2, \ \text{what is} \ f(x \ + \ 3)
\text{Which of the following is equivalent to } \dfrac{x^2 \ + \ 6x \ + \ 9}{x^2 \ + \ 7x \ + \ 12} \ ?
\dfrac{x^4 y^3}{(x^2)^2 y^m} \text{ What is the value of } m?
\text{A certain type of floor tile covers an area of 7.75 square feet for every three tiles.} \\ \text{How many tiles of this type are needed to cover an area of 186 square feet?}
4b \ - \ 3 \ > \ 7, \ \text{find the greatest integer value of } \ -2b \ + \ 4
\text{A square has diagonal } 12\sqrt{2} \ \text{in. What is the Area of the square in inches ?.}
\dfrac{2y - (2y + 1)}{3} = \dfrac{4y + (3 - 4y)}{y} \text{\ What is the value of y?.}
\text{How many solutions does the system have? } \begin{cases} 2y \ + \ x \ = \ 9 \\ 27 \ - \ 3x \ = \ 6y \end{cases}
\text{An electrician charges a service call fee plus an hourly fee. \ The graph shows total price vs. hours.} \\ \text{Based on the graph, what is the total charge for } 20\,\text{hours?}
\text{For what value of } x \ \text{is } h(x) = \dfrac{f(x)}{g(x)} \ \text{undefined?}

\text{The graph represents the change in price per share (in dollars) of a certain stock during two} \\ \text{business weeks. If the coordinates of the maximum are } (a, b) \text{ and the coordinates of the minimum} \\ \text{are } (c, d), \\ \text{what is the value of } \frac{d - b}{c - a}?

\text{Kush currently scores 400 on the SAT math section.} \\ \text{He sets a goal to improve this score by 1\% each day.} \\ \text{At this rate, approximately how many days} \\ \text{will it take him to score an 800?}

\text{The scatterplot relates the time when a farmer planted a crop to the yield of that crop.} \\ \text{Which of the following is the approximate difference, in bushels, between the yield predicted} \\ \text{by the line of best fit and the actual yield of the greatest outlier from the predicted value?}
\text{Line a is parallel to line c. Which of the following statements is true?}
\text{Given the system of inequalities:} \\ 8x \leq 24y + 40, \\ 3x \leq 6y + 12, \\ \text{what is the greatest possible value of } x?

\text{At a certain store, 4 knives, 5 spoons, and 6 forks cost } \$7.90. \\ \text{To purchase 2 knives, 2 spoons, and 5 forks would cost } \$5.80. \\ \text{How much do 2 knives, 3 spoons, and 1 fork cost?}
\text{If } x \neq 3, \ y \neq -5, \ \text{and } xy = 15, \ \text{which of the following is equivalent to } \frac{1}{x - 3} + \frac{5}{y}?
\text{The range of the parabola shown in the graph above is } \\ y > -4. \\ \text{If the equation } y = ax^2 + bx + c \\ \text{is used to represent the graph, what is the value of } a?

\text{A thrift store prices a piece of used furniture at } \$100. \\ \text{The price is marked down an additional } p \text{ percent every month} \\ \text{until it is sold.} \\ \text{If the piece of furniture is sold for } \$64 \\ \text{after two months, what is } p\text{?}

\text{The figure shows a rodeo arena} \\ \text{divided into 12 equal sections, 4} \\ \text{of which contain bulls. If 64} \\ \text{4- yards are needed to reinforce} \\ \text{all the edges of the 4} \\ \text{bull sections, what is the radius,} \\ \text{in yards, of the arena?}

\text{A restaurant randomly surveyed customers to determine how long} \\ \text{customers are willing to wait for a table on a Friday} \\ \text{night versus a Saturday night. On average, approximately how many} \\ \text{minutes longer are customers willing to wait for a table on} \\ \text{a Saturday night than on a Friday night?}
